verses.text: And it came to pass after these things , that God did tempt Abraham , and said unto him, Abraham : and he said , Behold, \add here\add* I \add am\add*.\f + \fr 22.1 \ft Behold…: Heb. Behold me\f*

And he said , Take now thy son , thine only \add son\add* Isaac , whom thou lovest , and get thee into the land of Moriah ; and offer him there for a burnt offering upon one of the mountains which I will tell thee of. \p

¶ And Abraham rose up early in the morning , and saddled his ass , and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son , and clave the wood for the burnt offering , and rose up , and went unto the place of which God had told him.
Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes , and saw the place afar off.
And Abraham said unto his young men , Abide ye here with the ass ; and I and the lad will go yonder and worship , and come again to you.
And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering , and laid \add it\add* upon Isaac his son ; and he took the fire in his hand , and a knife ; and they went both of them together.

And Isaac spake unto Abraham his father , and said , My father : and he said , Here \add am\add* I, my son. And he said , Behold the fire and the wood : but where \add is\add* the lamb for a burnt offering ?\f + \fr 22.7 \ft lamb: or, kid\f*
And Abraham said , My son , God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt offering : so they went both of them together.
And they came to the place which God had told him of; and Abraham built an altar there, and laid the wood in order , and bound Isaac his son , and laid him on the altar upon the wood.
And Abraham stretched forth his hand , and took the knife to slay his son. \p
And the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* called unto him out of heaven , and said , Abraham , Abraham : and he said , Here \add am\add* I.
And he said , Lay not thine hand upon the lad , neither do thou any thing unto him: for now I know that thou fearest God , seeing thou hast not withheld thy son , thine only \add son\add* from me.

And Abraham lifted up his eyes , and looked , and behold behind \add him\add* a ram caught in a thicket by his horns : and Abraham went and took the ram , and offered him up for a burnt offering in the stead of his son.

And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovah-jireh : as it is said \add to\add* this day , In the mount of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* it shall be seen.\f + \fr 22.14 \ft Jehovah-jireh: that is, The Lord will see, or, provide\f* \p
¶ And the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* called unto Abraham out of heaven the second time ,
And said , By myself have I sworn , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, for because thou hast done this thing , and hast not withheld thy son , thine only \add son:\add*

That in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of the heaven , and as the sand which \add is\add* upon the sea shore ; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies ;\f + \fr 22.17 \ft shore: Heb. lip\f*
And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed ; because thou hast obeyed my voice.
So Abraham returned unto his young men , and they rose up and went together to Beer-sheba ; and Abraham dwelt at Beer-sheba. \p
¶ And it came to pass after these things , that it was told Abraham , saying , Behold, Milcah , she hath also born children unto thy brother Nahor ;
Huz his firstborn , and Buz his brother , and Kemuel the father of Aram ,
And Chesed , and Hazo , and Pildash , and Jidlaph , and Bethuel.
And Bethuel begat Rebekah : these eight Milcah did bear to Nahor , Abraham’s brother.\f + \fr 22.23 \ft Rebekah: Gr. Rebecca\f*
And his concubine , whose name \add was\add* Reumah , she bare also Tebah , and Gaham , and Thahash , and Maachah.
